The three lives of NATO, born from a gamble, now deemed obsolete by Trump
subhead: Created out of America's desire to protect Europe from communism, the North Atlantic Alliance underwent profound changes after the fall of the Berlin Wall. It expanded and took on new missions, though it never fully proved its effectiveness. Today, it faces fierce challenges from Donald Trump.

title: Trump congratulates himself on Israel-Iran ceasefire that remains highly uncertain
Israel hails 'tremendous victory' over Iran as focus shifts back to Gaza hostages
byline: By Luc Bronner (Tel Aviv (Israel), special correspondent)

title: Raphaël Glucksmann sets out policy platform for 2027 French presidential election
subhead: The member of the European Parliament laid out his party's 'vision for France' on Monday in Paris. The project, focused on Europe, the environment and a 'social contract,' aims to revive 'a pro-European and deeply democratic left.'

title: Oman taxing the richest: 'It will be interesting to see if Muscat starts a trend'
subhead: By introducing a 5% income tax on the wealthiest Omanis starting in 2028, the sultanate becomes the first Gulf country to implement such a measure. It is a way to anticipate a decline in oil revenues as global crude prices continue to trend downward, writes Le Monde columnist Isabelle Chaperon.

title: A century of MI5 secrets are being revealed in the UK's National Archives
subhead: A unique exhibition traces the history of the legendary British domestic intelligence agency and features a wealth of original documents in a bid to maintain public trust and to counter conspiracy theories.

title: 'They come in vans and arrest mothers': Fear of immigration raids grips Chicago
subhead: In Chicago, another sanctuary city targeted by Donald Trump, residents have been organizing to thwart arrests by federal immigration agents and protect the country's second-largest Mexican community, after Los Angeles.
byline: By Ivanne Trippenbach (Chicago, Illinois, special correspondent)

The challenges of a 'Pax Hebraica' in the Middle East
subhead: The bombing of Iran's main nuclear sites by the US marks the triumph of Israel, which in just a few months has become the sheriff of the Middle East, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: The Heritage Foundation sets its sights on Europe
subhead: Since the beginning of his term, Donald Trump has been applying Project 2025, a 922-page bible written by the conservative think tank. Today, its president, Kevin Roberts, is looking across the Atlantic. On a visit to France, he met with leaders of far-right parties.

title: Refusing to become a manager is more common in France than elsewhere
subhead: According to an international survey by Cegos, a significant share of employees showed little interest in becoming managers, especially in France. The reasons include organizational culture, the image of the managerial role and the emergence of alternative models of professional success.
